mental Matters A Look Into StudentAthlete Mental Health

Blue Devils Come Up Short On National Television

The Owl House Ends with Poignant Spectacular Finale

Womens Soccer Finishes Regular Season With Win Over Wagner

CCSU Hosts Connecticut Supreme Court Hearings at Davidson Hall

by Kristina Vakhman

The Student Government Association meets every Wednesday at  p.m PERIOD in Bellin A and B in the Student Center PERIOD

 A resolution written by Senator Victor Constanza regarding the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals DACA passed  PERIOD The resolution proclaims that the SGA stands in solidarity with DACA recipients especially those who are Central Connecticut State University students PERIOD Moreover a letter on SGAs stance on DACAwith the signatures of SGA memberswill be sent to Connecticuts state representatives PERIOD

 The implementation of new educational programs on diversity and equality is being worked on by President Brendan Kruh Senator Constanza the Black Student Union and others PERIOD

 Progress has been made on the plan to apply plaques with student resource information on every door in the residence halls PERIOD The drafting of quotes for the plaques and a budget is still needed PERIOD

 There are  applicants for the eight senate seats currently open in the SGA President Kruh called the figure astonishing and stated he had never encountered a number of applicants as high as this in his time in the SGA PERIOD

 The Central Connecticut State University Society of Professional Journalists contingency request for . did not pass Finance Committee and was thus denied according to Treasurer Christopher Cappiello PERIOD

 Due to the fact that Hilltop Cafe has been deemed economically efficient there are plans to either make it open only at night or open only for special events PERIOD Additionally there is discussion of it becoming a second Devils Den an eatery with a pub for ofage students or a learning environment for culinary arts in the far future PERIOD

 Memorial Hall is having plumbing issues these issues were previously fixed for  on top of the buildings approximate  renovation over winter break PERIOD President Kruh said he was informed it would cost less to simply close Memorial Hall than to have any of its problems resolved PERIOD

The Recorder

The Student News Site of Central Connecticut State University
